name: Armstead, Alexander
title: School Support Specialist / Community Manager
notes: Music educator turned customer experience professional; based in Petaluma, CA. Clever Inc. is a San Francisco-based edtech company serving 75%+ of U.S. K-12 schools.

name: Bajzer, Marko
title: Music Teacher / Lecturer
notes: Croatian-American composer, visual artist, bassoonist, wilderness guide, and educator based in San Francisco Bay Area. Former Managing Director of Mercury Soul; lecturer at CSU East Bay; composer whose work premiered by Reno Philharmonic in 2025. Former artist-in-residence at Great Basin National Park (2023).

name: Barber, Patrick Victor
title: President, San Francisco Bay Area & Southern California
political_donations: $500 to VOTESANE PAC (06/2017); $500 to VOTESANE PAC (06/2017)
ngos: San Francisco Association of Realtors (past president); California Association of Realtors (executive committee); Susan G. Komen San Francisco affiliate (president); Wine & Food Society of San Francisco (Board of Governors); San Francisco Ballet (associate trustee); Bachelors of San Francisco (chairman and president); San Francisco Encore (founder and president)
notes: Former President of Pacific Union International (2014-2018), growing firm from 375 to 1,800+ agents before merger with Compass. Previously EVP and managing broker at Sotheby's International Realty San Francisco and Wine Country.

name: Bass, Randol Alan
title: Founder / Music Director and Conductor (founding)
notes: American composer, conductor, pianist, and singer born in Fort Worth, TX (1953). Founded Austin Symphonic Band (1982) and Metropolitan Winds of Dallas (1993). Works commissioned and performed by Dallas Symphony, Cleveland Orchestra, Boston Pops, Chicago Symphony, Houston Symphony, and others. Gloria premiered at Carnegie Hall (1990) by NY Pops under Skitch Henderson.

name: Benson, John E.
title: Associate Justice (retired)
notes: Served on San Francisco Superior Court for 12 years and on the 1st District Court of Appeal (Division Two) from 1986 to 1994. Rated by local bar as best and most hardworking judge in San Francisco. Deceased.

name: Bingham, Wheelock Richard Jr.
title: CEO / President
notes: CFA-credentialed financial advisor based in San Francisco, CA. Previously at Stifel Nicolaus & Company; founded Bingham Private Wealth (RIA) after departing Stifel. Also known as 'Lock Bingham'. Holds CRPS and CPWA designations.

name: Bliss, Frank
title: Agent / President
ngos: Berkeley Symphony (supporter/advertiser); Cazadero Performing Arts Camps; Young People's Symphony Orchestra; San Francisco Opera; Albany Music Fund
notes: Two distinct Frank Bliss professionals may be relevant: (1) State Farm agent in Berkeley, CA with music background (BA Music UC Berkeley, MA Music Univ. of Illinois), former SF Symphony educational activities coordinator and violinist with Oakland Symphony; (2) President at Cooper (real estate/law firm) in Newport Beach, CA (JD Univ. of Michigan Law School, BA UNC Chapel Hill).

name: Bonney, J. Dennis
title: Vice Chairman of the Board (retired)
ngos: Commonwealth Club of California / World Affairs Council of California (past president and chair)
notes: Born December 22, 1930; died November 5, 2024 in San Francisco, age 93. Joined Chevron 1960; served as Vice Chairman and Director 1987-1995, responsible for worldwide oil and gas exploration and production. Career focused on international operations including Africa and Middle East.

name: Borg, Christopher
title: Executive Director (former)
notes: Served as Executive Director of San Francisco Community Music Center for six years. Holds graduate degree in viola performance from Northwestern University and BA in music history from Vassar College. No longer in that role; current position not confirmed.

name: Brightbill, Hans D.
title: Senior Scientist / Scientific Director, In Vivo Pharmacology
ngos: Bay Area Rainbow Symphony (principal cello); Sonoma County Philharmonic (principal cello)
notes: Previously Senior Scientific Manager at Genentech (Discovery Immunology). PhD in microbiology and immunology from UCLA; postdoc at UC Berkeley. Double degree in cello performance and biological sciences from UC Irvine. Research focus on NF-kB signaling and immune therapeutics.

name: Brown, Aaron B.
title: Executive (product/brand)
notes: San Francisco-based technology executive at Panasonic Well, Panasonic Holdings' health and wellness technology incubator. Specializes in product management, marketing, and brand experience.

name: Brummel, Jonathan J.
title: Director, CX Technical Strategy & Innovation
notes: Also held title of Director of Enterprise Support and Critical Customer Engagement Director at Zendesk (San Francisco). Holds Doctor of Musical Arts in Trombone Performance from University of Minnesota; former professor at CSU Fresno and CSU Stanislaus.

name: Burkhart, David
title: Principal / President (former)
notes: Former president of SynergeticsUSA Inc. (Tustin, CA). Organizational development and talent professional; MA in Industrial/Organizational Psychology. Also worked as Senior Talent Development Specialist at Employers Group and HR project specialist at Steelcase North America.

name: Chang, Fred
title: Founder / Vice Chairman of the Board
notes: Taiwanese-born American entrepreneur; founded Newegg in January 2001 in City of Industry, CA. Served as CEO and Chairman through 2008; transitioned to Vice Chairman and Chairman of Strategy Committee in December 2019. Previously founded ABS Computer Technologies (1990). Debuted on Forbes 400 in 2013 and Forbes World Billionaires in 2014.

name: Chang, Stephen
notes: Multiple Stephen Chang professionals in California; no confirmed unique match to a Bohemian Grove member without additional identifying information.

name: Chen, Kevin H.
notes: Multiple Kevin H. Chen professionals in California (technology, academia); no confirmed unique match without additional identifying information.

name: Cosby, Jonathan W. B.
title: Treasurer
notes: Pacific Maritime Association (PMA) is a San Francisco-based non-profit representing shipping industry employers on the Pacific coast in labor negotiations with ILWU.

name: Craves, Evan
title: Program Manager
notes: Based in Santa Rosa, CA. Violinist and co-founder of TSQ (The String Quartet). Former concertmaster of American Philharmonic Sonoma County. BA/BS from UC Davis.

name: Eshima, Shinji Takane
employer: San Francisco Opera / San Francisco Ballet Orchestra
title: Double Bassist / Associate Principal Double Bass
notes: Japanese-American musician, composer, and teacher born in Berkeley, CA. Member of San Francisco Opera since 1980 and SF Ballet Orchestra since 1982. Teaches at San Francisco State University (since 1991) and SF Conservatory of Music (since 2000). BA Music from Stanford (1978); MM from Juilliard (1979).

name: Essert, William
employer: Bay Grab Bar / Wooden Window, Inc.
title: Owner
notes: Based in Piedmont, CA. Graduated from Northwestern University (music); former trumpet player with Oakland Symphony and Memphis Symphony Orchestra. Former Educational Activities Coordinator for SF Symphony. Licensed contractor specializing in Northern California architecture preservation. Certified Aging in Place Specialist (CAPS).

name: Ference, George Michael
notes: FINRA BrokerCheck record exists (CRD #6537988) indicating registration as financial professional.

name: Fox, Fred
notes: Multiple Fred Fox professionals in California Bay Area; no confirmed unique match to a Bohemian Grove member without additional identifying information.

name: Fredrich, Daniel S.
title: President (former)
notes: Previously president of Table Mountain Foods, Inc. (San Francisco, CA). Associated with three companies over 23 years, all now inactive. Resides in Ross, CA.

name: Ginwala, Cyrus
title: Professor of Music / Director, School of Music
ngos: Morrison Chamber Music Center (Artistic Director, since 2018)
notes: Appointed Artistic Director of Morrison Chamber Music Center at SF State in 2018. Previously Music Director of Symphony of the Mountains (1996-2005). Relocated to San Francisco Bay Area in 2005. Faculty at SF State.

name: GoGwilt, Cai P.
title: Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer
notes: Co-founded Ironclad (San Francisco, 2014) with Jason Boehmig. Ironclad is contract lifecycle management software valued at $3.2B with $333M raised from Y Combinator, Accel, Sequoia Capital. Previously software engineer at Palantir Technologies. BS and MS in CS and Physics from MIT. Concert cellist.

name: Goff, Hall N.
title: Trombonist
ngos: San Francisco Contemporary Music Players (since 1979); Golden Gate Park Band (since 2009)
notes: Member of San Francisco Ballet Orchestra since 1977. Former orchestra member at Festival of Two Worlds in Spoleto, Italy and Macerata Opera Festival.

name: Goldman, Kenneth S.
title: President
notes: Former CFO of Yahoo (2012-2017), Fortinet, Siebel Systems, Excite@Home, and Sybase. President of Hillspire LLC (family office) in Palo Alto, CA. Board member: RingCentral, Fortinet, C3.AI (appointed May 2025), Kodiak Robotics. Has served on 40+ corporate boards. BS Electrical Engineering from Cornell; MBA from Harvard Business School. Resides in Atherton, CA.
